Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of large Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with part of large rosette in added white and red in tondo, with two white bands around it; exterior: bowl wholly worn; foot glazed streaky black (and worn); near bottom of foot two white bands; reserved band around edge of foot; some white slip on underside; inscriptions on underside and exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 419 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 749, pl. XXI, no. 749)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 400)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 51)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0660) (phase 2)
